metadata.research_topic: Feature Comparison of Agentic AI Frameworks

claims.claim: LangChain has approximately 122K GitHub stars as of late 2024
claims.verification_notes: Verified via GitHub - actual count ~122K, growing from ~65K in early 2024

claims.claim: LangChain has 28 million monthly downloads and 130M+ total downloads
claims.verification_notes: Consistent across multiple sources including Contrary Research

claims.claim: Over 132K LLM applications built using LangChain with 4K+ open-source contributors
claims.verification_notes: Self-reported metric from company, difficult to independently verify

claims.claim: LangChain has 600+ integrations connecting to major LLMs, tools, and databases
claims.verification_notes: Widely cited across multiple independent sources

claims.claim: CrewAI has approximately 41K GitHub stars
claims.verification_notes: Verifiable via GitHub repository

claims.claim: CrewAI averages close to 1 million monthly downloads
claims.verification_notes: Cited by multiple sources including investor reports

claims.claim: CrewAI claims 40-60% Fortune 500 adoption, though many may be pilot projects
claims.verification_notes: DISPUTED: Claims vary (40% to 60%+), self-reported by company and investors (Insight Partners). eMarketer clarified these are 'pilot projects' not production deployments. Figures escalated from 40% to 60%+ within months. Cannot independently verify.

claims.claim: CrewAI customers include IBM, PwC, and has AWS partnership
claims.verification_notes: Some customers verified via case studies page, but full customer list is self-reported

claims.claim: CrewAI raised $18M by October 2024, Series A led by Insight Partners
claims.verification_notes: Verified via press releases and investor announcements from multiple sources

claims.claim: AutoGen has over 33K GitHub stars with 290+ contributors
claims.verification_notes: Verifiable via GitHub repository

claims.claim: AutoGen has 890,000+ downloads of the Python package
claims.verification_notes: Microsoft Research figure from May 2024, may be outdated

claims.claim: AutoGen adopted by over 40% of Fortune 100 firms
claims.verification_notes: UNVERIFIED: Single source claim (Arcade.dev). Could not find corroboration from Microsoft or independent sources. Treat with caution.

claims.claim: AutoGen excels at autonomous code generation with self-correction capabilities
claims.verification_notes: Consistent across multiple technical comparisons and HackerNews discussions

claims.claim: AutoGen achieved No. 1 accuracy on GAIA benchmark in all three levels (March 2024)
claims.verification_notes: Verified via Microsoft Research announcement

claims.claim: OpenAI Agents SDK has approximately 9-10K GitHub stars
claims.verification_notes: Verifiable via GitHub repository

claims.claim: OpenAI Agents SDK is provider-agnostic, supporting 100+ LLMs
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official OpenAI documentation

claims.claim: Core primitives include Agents, Handoffs, Guardrails, Sessions, and Function Tools
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official OpenAI documentation

claims.claim: Claude Agent SDK provides context management with automatic compaction, rich tool ecosystem, and MCP extensibility
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official Anthropic documentation

claims.claim: Claude Agent SDK design principle is to give agents a computer, enabling human-like work patterns
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official Anthropic engineering blog

claims.claim: AWS Bedrock AgentCore offers Runtime, Gateway, Memory, Identity, Browser, Code Interpreter, Observability, Evaluations, and Policy services
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official AWS documentation and GA announcement

claims.claim: AWS Bedrock Agents support multi-agent collaboration with supervisor agent coordination
claims.verification_notes: Verified via official AWS documentation

claims.claim: Robinhood scaled from 500M to 5B tokens daily using Amazon Bedrock, cutting AI costs by 80%
claims.verification_notes: Verified - direct quote from Robinhood Head of AI in AWS announcement

claims.claim: 79% of organizations report AI agent adoption; market projected to reach $199B by 2034
claims.verification_notes: Multiple sources cite similar figures, but underlying methodology varies

claims.claim: Gartner predicts 33% of enterprise software will have agentic AI by 2028
claims.verification_notes: Verified Gartner prediction widely cited

claims.claim: Gartner predicts 40% of agentic AI projects will be canceled by 2027
claims.verification_notes: Verified via Gartner press release, widely cited and accepted by industry

claims.claim: CrewAI prioritizes simplicity with role-based design, easiest for beginners
claims.verification_notes: Consistent across multiple independent comparisons and community feedback

claims.claim: LangChain has significant criticism for complexity, documentation issues, and breaking changes, but also strong defenders citing ecosystem breadth
claims.verification_notes: Strong evidence for both criticism AND defense. v0.1.0 (Jan 2024) addressed some stability concerns. Critics cite bloat, abstraction layers; defenders cite integrations, ecosystem

claims.claim: LangGraph has ~12K GitHub stars and 4.2M monthly downloads, best for enterprise state management
claims.verification_notes: Verifiable via GitHub and package registry

claims.claim: AWS Bedrock AgentCore SDK downloaded over 1 million times by enterprise customers
claims.verification_notes: Verified via AWS GA announcement blog post

claims.claim: Microsoft has announced Agent Framework to replace AutoGen and Semantic Kernel for new development
claims.verification_notes: Verified via VentureBeat and Microsoft announcements - AutoGen/Semantic Kernel in maintenance mode
